Create a new 2D sketch on face 1 of the coordinate system. 1. Draw line 1 from (0, 0) to (0.4286, 0). 2. Draw line 2 from (0.4286, 0) to (0.4286, 0.75). 3. Draw line 3 from (0.4286, 0.75) to (0, 0.75). 4. Draw line 4 from (0, 0.75) to (0, 0). Close the loop. Scale the 2D sketch by 0.75. Transform the scaled sketch into 3D using rotation angles (0, 0, -90) and translation vector (0, 0.4286, 0). Extrude the 2D sketch with an extrusion depth of 0.4286 towards the normal and set the operation as 'Add' as it adds materials to the prism. Part 2 Create a new coordinate system with euler angles (0, 0, 0) and translation vector (0.0268, 0.0268, 0.75) for the second CAD part. Draw a new 2D sketch on face 1 of the new coordinate system. 1. Draw line 1 from (0, 0) to (0.375, 0). 2. Draw line 2 from (0.375, 0) to (0.375, 0.375). 3. Draw line 3 from (0.375, 0.375) to (0, 0.375). 4. Draw line 4 from (0, 0.375) to (0, 0). Close the loop. Do not scale the 2D sketch of the second CAD part. Transform the sketch into 3D using the same coordinate system and extrude it with an extrusion depth of 0.6161 opposite the normal. The volume will be removed from the previous part due to the 'Subtract' operation here. With these instructions, the junior CAD designer should be able to build the given CAD models accurately. Remember to provide the height, width, and length of each of the intermediate parts and the final shape as described in the JSON data. Make sure to not include any specific terms such as 'NewBodyFeatureOperation', 'CutFeatureOperation' in the instructions and instead use their natural language descriptions.</description>
